name: v1.1.0
body:
Note: this release updates the default SWC version from `1.3.42` to `1.3.75`. You may be forced to update the version of any swc plugins you use, as they are not binary-compatible and can cause a Rust backtrace/crash.

## Using [Bzlmod] with Bazel 6:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_swc", version = "1.1.0")
```

[Bzlmod]: https://bazel.build/build/bzlmod

## Using WORKSPACE

```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_swc",
    sha256 = "8eb9e42ed166f20cacedfdb22d8d5b31156352eac190fc3347db55603745a2d8",
    strip_prefix = "rules_swc-1.1.0",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/releases/download/v1.1.0/rules_swc-v1.1.0.tar.gz",
)

###################
# rules_swc setup #
###################

# Fetches the rules_swc dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@aspect_rules_swc//swc:dependencies.bzl", "rules_swc_dependencies")

rules_swc_dependencies()

# Fetches a SWC cli from
# https://github.com/swc-project/swc/releases
# If you'd rather compile it from source, you can use rules_rust, fetch the project,
# then register the toolchain yourself. (Note, this is not yet documented)
load("@aspect_rules_swc//swc:repositories.bzl", "LATEST_SWC_VERSION", "swc_register_toolchains")

swc_register_toolchains(
    name = "swc",
    swc_version = LATEST_SWC_VERSION,
)
```


## What's Changed
* refactor: adopt tsconfig-to-swcconfig CLI by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/206
* chore: mirror latest swc release by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/207


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/compare/v1.0.2...v1.1.0

* chore: docs updates before 1.0 by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/160
* refactor: force users to explicitly provide srcs by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/161
* refactor: only use underlying rule where required by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/162

* docs: explain out_dir with output_dir by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/164

* chore: update to rules_js 1.19.0 by @gregmagolan in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/168
* chore: update to swc v1.3.36 by @titanous in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/169
* chore: update to aspect_bazel_lib 1.27.2 by @gregmagolan in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/170
* chore: mirror latest swc release by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/171
* Fix sourcemaps by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/174
* chore: simplify WORKSPACE by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/172
* feat: add a new source_root attribute by @realtimetodie in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/177
* test: use write_source_files where possible by @jbedard in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/178
* refactor: no default value for source_root by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/179
* chore: update to Aspect CLI 5.2.0-rc0 by @gregmagolan in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/180
* fix: set sourcemap root to the workspace relative root_dir by @jbedard in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/176
* fix: do not specify empty --source-root arg by @jbedard in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/182
* test: change sourcemap tests to json assertions by @jbedard in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/181
* refactor: prevent adding unused source maps options by @realtimetodie in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/183
* chore: update to Aspect CLI 5.2.1 by @gregmagolan in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/184
* ci: add the windows runner to the matrix strategy by @realtimetodie in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/186
* chore: mirror new swc version by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/190
* chore: update swc v1.3.41 by @realtimetodie in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/188
* fix: windows CI by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/187
* chore: update dependencies by @gregmagolan in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/191

## New Contributors
* @titanous made their first contribution in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/149

name: v0.21.0
body:
This release uses the "swcx" CLI: https://github.com/swc-project/swc/discussions/3859

Thanks to help from @realtimetodie, the latest release of swc (v1.3.25) has fixes needed for us to run the "pure-rust" CLI, and avoid any node.js process running. This makes it much faster to launch many small processes. Note, our TS benchmarks in https://blog.aspect.dev/rules-ts-benchmarks already used this patch, now that it's released you should get similar performance.

**BREAKING CHANGES:**

We are getting close to 1.0, so this is the chance to make disruptive changes before entering a semver guarantee.

- Minimum version of swc is now v1.3.25
- An explicit version now has to be given to swc_register_toolchains; we don't silently default to latest
- the term "transpile" is not typically used in swc, so the underlying rule `swc_transpile` has been renamed `swc_compile` matching the "compile" command

WORKSPACE snippet:
```starlark
load("@bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_swc",
    sha256 = "71bff4030067e3898a98a60918745a168b166256393d1ea566f72b118460d4ef",
    strip_prefix = "rules_swc-0.21.0",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/archive/refs/tags/v0.21.0.tar.gz",
)

###################
# rules_swc setup #
###################

# Fetches the rules_swc dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,
# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've
# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@aspect_rules_swc//swc:dependencies.bzl", "rules_swc_dependencies")

rules_swc_dependencies()

# Fetches a SWC cli from
# https://github.com/swc-project/swc/releases
# If you'd rather compile it from source, you can use rules_rust, fetch the project,
# then register the toolchain yourself. (Note, this is not yet documented)
load("@aspect_rules_swc//swc:repositories.bzl", "LATEST_VERSION", "swc_register_toolchains")

swc_register_toolchains(
    name = "swc",
    swc_version = LATEST_VERSION,
)
```


## What's Changed
* run bare rust CLI binary, no node by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/57
* feat: read swc version from package.json by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/135
* chore: cleanup paths example by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/132
* fix: map alternative ts file extensions by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/133
* docs: enable_runfiles is no longer required since we don't use rules_js by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/137
* chore: add MODULE.bazel file by @alexeagle in https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/pull/138


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_swc/compare/v0.20.2...v0.21.0

###################
# rules_swc setup #
###################

# Fetches the rules_swc dependencies.

# you should fetch it *before* calling this.

# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@aspect_rules_swc//swc:dependencies.bzl", "rules_swc_dependencies")

rules_swc_dependencies()

# Fetches a pre-built Rust-node binding from
# https://github.com/swc-project/swc/releases.

# then register the toolchain yourself. (Note, this is not yet documented)

swc_register_toolchains(
    name = "swc",
    swc_version = LATEST_VERSION,
)

# You can skip this if you already register a nodejs toolchain.
load("@rules_nodejs//nodejs:repositories.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "nodejs_register_toolchains")

nodejs_register_toolchains(
    name = "nodejs",
    node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION,
)
